column4: hello there...who can tell me how to boot into the command line mode...It seems the old /etc/inittab is
hello there...who can tell me how to boot into the command line mode...It seems the old /etc/inittab is not available on Intrepid
why?
why??
yes.  Why do you you want to exactly?  Since the reason you want to affects how you would...
can you help me with my question?
You never answered mine.  Do you just not want X to startup by default forever?
...no...I wanna start x from cli with startx...
system -> administration -> services, disable graphical login
.....I'm not using gnome...
........ what are you using..........?
......Xmonad...
and I'm not boot into gnome env
If you don't have 'services-admin', then either install it or install sysv-rc-conf and use that to stop gdm from starting on runlevels 2-5
sysv-rc-conf.....can you tell which files decide and I can configure manually???
man update-rc.d
like the old /etc/inittab
runlevels 2-5 are identical by default so inittab isn't relevant
if you want to know how to use inittab for other reasons, see upstart.ubuntu.com.  It's not helpful here though
...runlevel 2-5 r identical???...I remembered runlevel 5 is graphical...
not on debian (and not on ubuntu)
no I'm not bothering with inittab...
